H0.text: Protons are the subatomic particles whose number determines an element’s atomic number and distinguishes one element from another.

H1.text: Neutrons are the subatomic particles whose number determines an element’s atomic number and is used to distinguish one element from another.

H2.text: Quarks are the subatomic particles whose number determines an element’s atomic number and distinguishes one element from another.

H3.text: Electrons are the subatomic particles whose number determines an element’s atomic number and distinguishes one element from another.

A4.text: The number of protons in the nucleus is the defining property of an element, and is referred to as the atomic number (represented by the symbol Z).
